item.text: At the end of two full years Pharaoh had a dream. As he was standing by the Nile,

<st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="03303" class="">fine</st>-<st data-num="04758" class="">looking</st>, <st data-num="01277 01320">fat</st> <st data-num="06510" class="">cows</st> were <st data-num="05927" class="">coming up</st> <st data-num="02009 04480">out of</st> the <st data-num="02975" class="">Nile</st>,<n id="1" /> and they <st data-num="07462" class="">grazed</st> in the <st data-num="0260" class="">reeds</st>.

<st data-num="02009" class="">Then</st> <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="07451" class="">bad</st>-<st data-num="04758" class="">looking</st>, <st data-num="01851 01320">thin</st> <st data-num="06510" class="">cows</st> were <st data-num="05927" class="">coming up</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">after</st> them <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="02975" class="">Nile</st>,<n id="1" /> and they <st data-num="05975" class="">stood</st> <st data-num="0681" class="">beside</st> the <st data-num="0312" class="">other</st> <st data-num="06510" class="">cows</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">at</st> the <st data-num="08193" class="">edge</st> of the <st data-num="02975" class="">river</st>.<n id="2" />
The bad-looking, thin cows ate the seven fine-looking, fat cows. Then Pharaoh woke up.
Then he fell asleep again and had a second dream: There were seven heads of grain growing on one stalk, healthy and good.

<st data-num="02009" class="">Then</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="07641" class="">heads of grain</st>, <st data-num="01851" class="">thin</st> and <st data-num="07710" class="">burned</st> by the <st data-num="06921" class="">east wind</st>, were <st data-num="06779" class="">sprouting up</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">after</st> them.
The thin heads swallowed up the seven healthy and full heads. Then Pharaoh woke up and realized it was a dream.
In the morning he was troubled, so he called for all the diviner-priests of Egypt and all its wise men. Pharaoh told them his dreams, but no one could interpret them for him.

Then the <st data-num="08269" class="">chief</st> <st data-num="04945" class="">cupbearer</st> <st data-num="01696 0559">said</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">to</st> <st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st>, “<st data-num="03117" class="">Today</st> <st data-num="0589" class="">I</st> <st data-num="02142" class="">recall</st> my <st data-num="02399" class="">failures</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st> <st data-num="07107" class="">was enraged</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">with</st> his <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st>, and he <st data-num="05414" class="">put</st> me in <st data-num="04929" class="">prison</st> in the <st data-num="01004" class="">house</st> of the <st data-num="08269" class="">captain</st> of the <st data-num="02876" class="">guards</st>—me and the <st data-num="08269" class="">chief</st> <st data-num="0644" class="">baker</st>.

We <st data-num="0589 01931">each</st> <st data-num="02492" class="">had</st> a <st data-num="02472" class="">dream</st> <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> <st data-num="03915" class="">night</st>; <st data-num="0376" class="">each</st> of us <st data-num="02492" class="">had</st> a <st data-num="02472" class="">dream</st> with its own <st data-num="06623" class="">meaning</st>.<n id="1" />

Now a <st data-num="05288" class="">young man</st>, a <st data-num="05680" class="">Hebrew</st>, a <st data-num="05650" class="">servant</st><n id="1" /> of the <st data-num="08269" class="">captain</st> of the <st data-num="02876" class="">guards</st>,<n id="2" /> was <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> us <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st>. We <st data-num="05608" class="">told</st> him our <st data-num="02472" class="">dreams</st>,<n id="3" /> and he <st data-num="06622" class="">interpreted</st> the <st data-num="06622" class="">meaning of</st> <st data-num="0582" class="">each</st> of our respective <st data-num="02472" class="">dreams</st> for us.<n id="4" />
It happened just as he had said to us—Pharaoh restored me to my office, but he impaled the baker.”
Then Pharaoh summoned Joseph. So they brought him quickly out of the dungeon; he shaved himself, changed his clothes, and came before Pharaoh.

<st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="03130" class="">Joseph</st>, “I <st data-num="02492" class="">had</st> a <st data-num="02472" class="">dream</st>,<n id="1" /> and <st data-num="0369" class="">there is no</st> one who can <st data-num="06622" class="">interpret</st><n id="2" /> it. But <st data-num="0589" class="">I</st> have <st data-num="08085" class="">heard</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">about</st> you, <st data-num="0559" class="">that</st><n id="3" /> you can <st data-num="08085 06622">interpret</st> <st data-num="02472" class="">dreams</st>.”<n id="4" />
Joseph replied to Pharaoh, “It is not within my power, but God will speak concerning the welfare of Pharaoh.”
Then Pharaoh said to Joseph, “In my dream I was standing by the edge of the Nile.

<st data-num="02009" class="">Then</st> <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="01277 01320">fat</st> and <st data-num="03303" class="">fine</st>-<st data-num="08389" class="">looking</st> <st data-num="06510" class="">cows</st> were <st data-num="05927" class="">coming up</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">out of</st> the <st data-num="02975" class="">Nile</st>, and they <st data-num="07462" class="">grazed</st> in the <st data-num="0260" class="">reeds</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="02009" class="">Then</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="0312" class="">other</st> <st data-num="06510" class="">cows</st> <st data-num="05927" class="">came up</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">after</st> them; they were <st data-num="01803" class="">scrawny</st>, <st data-num="03966" class="">very</st> <st data-num="07451" class="">bad</st> <st data-num="08389" class="">looking</st>, and <st data-num="07534 01320">lean</st>. I had <st data-num="03808" class="">never</st> <st data-num="07200" class="">seen</st> such <st data-num="07455" class="">bad-looking</st> cows<n id="2" /> as <st data-num="02007" class="">these</st> in <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st>!

The <st data-num="07534" class="">lean</st>, <st data-num="07451" class="">bad-looking</st> <st data-num="06510" class="">cows</st> <st data-num="0398" class="">ate up</st> the <st data-num="07651 07223">seven</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="01277" class="">fat</st> <st data-num="06510" class="">cows</st>.

When they had <st data-num="0935 0413 07130">eaten</st> them,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03808" class="">no one</st> would have <st data-num="03045" class="">known</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">that</st> they had <st data-num="0935" class="">done</st> <st data-num="0413 07130">so</st>, for they were just as <st data-num="07451" class="">bad</st> <st data-num="04758" class="">looking</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">as</st> <st data-num="08462" class="">before</st>. Then I <st data-num="03364" class="">woke up</st>.

I <st data-num="02009" class="">also</st> <st data-num="07200" class="">saw</st> in my <st data-num="02472" class="">dream</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="07641" class="">heads of grain</st> <st data-num="05927" class="">growing</st> on <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> <st data-num="07070" class="">stalk</st>, <st data-num="04392" class="">full</st> and <st data-num="02896" class="">good</st>.

<st data-num="02009" class="">Then</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="07641" class="">heads of grain</st>, <st data-num="06798" class="">withered</st> and <st data-num="01851" class="">thin</st> and <st data-num="07710" class="">burned</st> with the <st data-num="06921" class="">east wind</st>, were <st data-num="06779" class="">sprouting up</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">after</st> them.
The thin heads of grain swallowed up the seven good heads of grain. So I told all this to the diviner-priests, but no one could tell me its meaning.”
Then Joseph said to Pharaoh, “Both dreams of Pharaoh have the same meaning. God has revealed to Pharaoh what he is about to do.

The <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="02896" class="">good</st> <st data-num="06510" class="">cows</st> <st data-num="02007" class="">represent</st> <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st>, and the <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="02896" class="">good</st> <st data-num="07641" class="">heads of grain</st> <st data-num="02007" class="">represent</st> <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st>. Both <st data-num="02472" class="">dreams</st> <st data-num="01931" class="">have</st> the <st data-num="0259" class="">same</st> meaning.<n id="1" />

The <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="07534" class="">lean</st>, <st data-num="07451" class="">bad-looking</st> <st data-num="06510" class="">cows</st> that <st data-num="05927" class="">came up</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">after</st> them <st data-num="02007" class="">represent</st> <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st>, as <st data-num="02007" class="">do</st> the <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="07386" class="">empty</st> <st data-num="07641" class="">heads of grain</st> <st data-num="07710" class="">burned</st> with the <st data-num="06921" class="">east wind</st>. They <st data-num="01961" class="">represent</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> of <st data-num="07458" class="">famine</st>.

<st data-num="01931" class="">This</st> is <st data-num="0834" class="">just</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">what</st> I <st data-num="01696 0413">told</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st>: <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> has <st data-num="07200" class="">shown</st> <st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">what</st> he is about to <st data-num="06213" class="">do</st>.

<st data-num="02009 07651">Seven</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> of <st data-num="01419" class="">great</st> <st data-num="07647" class="">abundance</st> are <st data-num="0935" class="">coming</st> throughout the <st data-num="03605" class="">whole</st> <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st>.

But <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> of <st data-num="07458" class="">famine</st> will <st data-num="06965" class="">occur</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0310" class="">after</st> them, and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="07647" class="">abundance</st> will be <st data-num="07911" class="">forgotten</st> in the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st>. The <st data-num="07458" class="">famine</st> will <st data-num="03615" class="">devastate</st><n id="2" /> the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st>.

The previous <st data-num="07647" class="">abundance</st> of the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> be <st data-num="03045" class="">remembered</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="06440" class="">because of</st> the <st data-num="07458" class="">famine</st> <st data-num="01931" class="">that</st> <st data-num="0310 03651">follows</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> the <st data-num="01931" class="">famine</st> will be <st data-num="03966" class="">very</st> <st data-num="03515" class="">severe</st>.<n id="2" />
The dream was repeated to Pharaoh because the matter has been decreed by God, and God will make it happen soon.
“So now Pharaoh should look for a wise and discerning man and give him authority over all the land of Egypt.

<st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st> should <st data-num="06213" class="">do</st><n id="1" /> this—he should <st data-num="06485" class="">appoint</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="06496" class="">officials</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">throughout</st> the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> to <st data-num="02567" class="">collect one-fifth</st> of the produce of the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st><n id="4" /> during the <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> of <st data-num="07647" class="">abundance</st>.

They should <st data-num="06908" class="">gather</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the excess <st data-num="0400" class="">food</st><n id="1" /> during <st data-num="0428" class="">these</st> <st data-num="02896" class="">good</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> that are <st data-num="0935" class="">coming</st>. <st data-num="08478" class="">By</st> <st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh’s</st> <st data-num="03027" class="">authority</st><n id="2" /> they should <st data-num="06651" class="">store up</st> <st data-num="01250" class="">grain</st> so the <st data-num="05892" class="">cities</st> will have <st data-num="0400" class="">food</st>,<n id="3" /> and they should <st data-num="08104" class="">preserve</st> it.<n id="4" />
This food should be held in storage for the land in preparation for the seven years of famine that will occur throughout the land of Egypt. In this way the land will survive the famine.”
This advice made sense to Pharaoh and all his officials.

So <st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st> <st data-num="0559 0413">asked</st> his <st data-num="05650" class="">officials</st>, “Can we <st data-num="04672" class="">find</st> a <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> like <st data-num="02088" class="">Joseph</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0376" class="">one</st> in <st data-num="0834" class="">whom</st> the <st data-num="07307" class="">Spirit</st> of <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> is present?”<n id="2" />

So <st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="03130" class="">Joseph</st>, “<st data-num="0310" class="">Because</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> has enabled you to <st data-num="03045" class="">know</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="02063" class="">this</st>, <st data-num="0369" class="">there is no</st> one as <st data-num="02450" class="">wise</st> and <st data-num="0995" class="">discerning</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="03644" class="">as</st> you are!
You will oversee my household, and all my people will submit to your commands. Only I, the king, will be greater than you.
“See here,” Pharaoh said to Joseph, “I place you in authority over all the land of Egypt.”

Then <st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st> <st data-num="05493" class="">took</st> his <st data-num="02885" class="">signet ring</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">from</st> his own <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st> and <st data-num="05414" class="">put</st> it <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> <st data-num="03027 03130">Joseph’s</st>. He <st data-num="03847" class="">clothed</st> him with <st data-num="08336" class="">fine linen</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0899" class="">clothes</st> and <st data-num="07760" class="">put</st> a <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> <st data-num="07242" class="">chain</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">around</st> his <st data-num="06677" class="">neck</st>.

Pharaoh<n id="1" /> had him <st data-num="07392" class="">ride</st> in the <st data-num="04818" class="">chariot</st> used by <st data-num="0834" class="">his</st> <st data-num="04932" class="">second-in-command</st>,<n id="2" /> and they <st data-num="07121" class="">cried out</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">before</st> him, “<st data-num="086" class="">Kneel down</st>!”<n id="3" /> So he <st data-num="05414" class="">placed</st> him <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st>.

<st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st> also <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="03130" class="">Joseph</st>, “<st data-num="0589" class="">I</st> am <st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st>, but <st data-num="01107" class="">without</st> your permission<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03808" class="">no</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">one</st><n id="2" /> will <st data-num="07311" class="">move</st> his <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st> or his <st data-num="07272" class="">foot</st><n id="3" /> in <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st>.”
Pharaoh gave Joseph the name Zaphenath-Paneah. He also gave him Asenath daughter of Potiphera, priest of On, to be his wife. So Joseph took charge of all the land of Egypt.
Now Joseph was 30 years old when he began serving Pharaoh king of Egypt. Joseph was commissioned by Pharaoh and was in charge of all the land of Egypt.

During the <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> of <st data-num="07647" class="">abundance</st> the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">produced</st> large, <st data-num="07062" class="">bountiful</st> harvests.<n id="1" />

Joseph<n id="1" /> <st data-num="06908" class="">collected</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the excess <st data-num="0400" class="">food</st><n id="2" /> in the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st> during the <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="08141 0834 01961">years</st> and <st data-num="05414" class="">stored</st> <st data-num="0400" class="">it</st> in the <st data-num="05892" class="">cities</st>.<n id="3" /> <st data-num="08432" class="">In</st> every <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st> he <st data-num="05414" class="">put</st> the <st data-num="0400" class="">food</st> gathered from the <st data-num="07704 0834">fields</st> <st data-num="05439" class="">around</st> it.
Joseph stored up a vast amount of grain, like the sand of the sea, until he stopped measuring it because it was impossible to measure.
Two sons were born to Joseph before the famine came. Asenath daughter of Potiphera, priest of On, was their mother.

<st data-num="03130" class="">Joseph</st> <st data-num="07121 08034">named</st> the <st data-num="01060" class="">firstborn</st> <st data-num="04519" class="">Manasseh</st>,<n id="1" /> saying,<n id="2" /> “<st data-num="03588" class="">Certainly</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> has made me <st data-num="05382" class="">forget</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> my <st data-num="05999" class="">trouble</st> and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> my <st data-num="01" class="">father’s</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">house</st>.”
He named the second child Ephraim, saying, “Certainly God has made me fruitful in the land of my suffering.”
The seven years of abundance in the land of Egypt came to an end.

Then the <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> of <st data-num="07458" class="">famine</st> <st data-num="02490 0935">began</st>,<n id="1" /> just <st data-num="0834" class="">as</st> <st data-num="03130" class="">Joseph</st> had <st data-num="0559" class="">predicted</st>. There <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> <st data-num="07458" class="">famine</st> in <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the other <st data-num="0776" class="">lands</st>, but <st data-num="03605" class="">throughout</st> the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st> there <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> <st data-num="03899" class="">food</st>.
When all the land of Egypt experienced the famine, the people cried out to Pharaoh for food. Pharaoh said to all the people of Egypt, “Go to Joseph and do whatever he tells you.”
While the famine was over all the earth, Joseph opened the storehouses and sold grain to the Egyptians. The famine was severe throughout the land of Egypt.
People from every country came to Joseph in Egypt to buy grain because the famine was severe throughout the earth.
